title: Engineering Manager, RFA Connectors
content:
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companiesâ€”from the worldâ€™s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startupsâ€”use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the Team
The RFA Connectors organization plays a crucial role as Stripe expands from payments to the RFA suite of products simplifying business processes for our users. The organization works on user-facing integrations that range from workflow automations in third-party ERP systems like Netsuite, no-code integrations w/ CRM systems like Salesforce for Stripe Billing, enabling users to bring in data from third-party systems to create a holistic view of their financial record as well as ability to export Stripe data for your business needs via the Stripe Data Pipeline. We are looking to invest significantly in becoming a platform enabling multiple products as well as enabling better quality integration building blocks for partners and ecosystem developers.
What youâ€™ll do
Weâ€™re looking for a seasoned engineering leader to lead the engineering strategy and execution for RFA Connectors organization. You will also invest in building the foundational platforms that will improve our engineering productivity and  innovation velocity. You will hire, mentor, and develop Engineering Managers and Software Engineers. 
Responsibilities
Recruit great engineers and engineering managers in collaboration with Stripeâ€™s recruiting team
Support the engineering team in achieving a high level of technical quality, reliability, and developer satisfaction
Mentor and coach managers to create healthy and well-executing teams
Develop the long-term vision and strategy for the team, prioritize accordingly, and create an execution roadmap
Partner with engineering, product leaders across RFA organization on clear strategies and roadmap to power their products and drive adoption via the portfolio of RFA Connectors.
Manage processes to help the team do its best work and engage effectively with the rest of Stripe
Empower the engineering team to achieve a high level of technical productivity, reliability and simplicity
Contribute to engineering-wide initiatives as a member of Stripeâ€™s engineering management team
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineering, product, partnership, legal, risk, etc.) to manage technical dependencies and achieve product deliverables.
Who you are
Weâ€™re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
Youâ€™ve hired, mentored and grown engineering managers and staff/principal  engineers.
You have great product taste and a track record of taking complex problems and solving them elegantly.
You enjoy diving into and deeply understanding the businesses that use Stripe.
You work very well cross-functionally, and are able to think rigorously and make hard decisions and tradeoffs.
You are capable of working in ambiguous fast-moving environments and have a curiosity to learn the domain to a deep level.
You thrive on a high level of autonomy and responsibility.
You encourage a healthy work environment thatâ€™s both supportive and challenging.
You can dive deep technically and collaborate with engineers on architecture and product decisions.
Preferred qualifications
Experience managing teams of 20+ engineers.
Experience in B2B SaaS integrations, data pipelines
Experience augmenting teams w/ vendors, managing vendor lifecycles and contracts
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar relevant background

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
